intro: Alsodeia lankawiensis, commonly known as the Lankawi alsodeia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Langkawi in Malaysia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant grows in rocky and coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to challenging environments. Its limited distribution and unique morphology make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and limited research, its conservation status remains uncertain.
